items.title: Easily Create and Bind Custom Event Objects in .NET MAUI Scheduler
items.description:
The .NET MAUI Scheduler control has nine types of built-in configurable view modes that provide basic functionalities for scheduling, managing, and representing appointments efficiently. It allows you to schedule events from any database. You can also easily bind any custom event (business) objects

items.title: No XAML? No Problem! Create Your .NET. MAUI UI in Code with C# Markup!
items.description:
C# Markup is a set of fluent helper methods and classes designed to simplify the process of building declarative .NET MAUI user interfaces in code. The C# Markup extensions are available through the .NET MAUI Community Toolkit and in this video we are going to see how to recreate the default template page in C# code!

No XAML? No Problem! Create Your .NET. MAUI UI in Code with C# Markup! by Gerald Versluis

items.title: Why You NEED .NET MAUI's new Dependency Injection
items.description:
.NET MAUI supports the dependency injection (DI) software design pattern, which is a technique for achieving Inversion of Control (IoC) between classes and their dependencies. On top of that it fully supports constructor injection and full dependency resolution when navigating when using Shell. James break down every little thing you need to know about DI, IoC, and constructor injection with .NET MAUI.

Why You NEED .NET MAUI's new Dependency Injection by James Montemagno
